Items.Title: Roll Call
Invocation
Items.AgendaNote:
Delivered by: Rev. Vanessa M. Brown, Rivers at Rehoboth Church, 263 W. 86th Street, N.Y. 10024.

Motion to spread the invocation in full upon the record by Council Member Rosenthal.
Items.MinutesNote:
The Invocation was delivered by: Rev. Vanessa M. Brown, Rivers at Rehoboth Church, 263 West 86th Street, New York, N.Y. 10024.



Council Member Rosenthal moved to spread the Invocation in full upon the Record.

Items.Title: Adoption of Minutes
Items.AgendaNote: Motion that the Minutes of the Stated Meeting of January 22, 2015 be adopted as printed by Council Member Chin.
Items.MinutesNote: Council Member Chin moved that the Minutes of the Stated Meeting of January 22, 2015 be adopted as printed.

Items.Title: Messages & Papers from the Mayor
Communication from the Mayor – Submitting Preliminary Mayor’s Management Report (PMMR) for Fiscal Year 2015.
Items.ActionName: Rcvd, Ord, Prnt, Fld by Council
Items.ActionText: This Mayor's Message was Rcvd, Ord, Prnt, Fld by Council
Items.MatterName: Submitting Preliminary Mayor’s Management Report (PMMR) for FY'15.

Items.Title: Communications from City, County & Borough Offices
Petitions and Communications
Land Use Call-Ups

By the Chair of the Land Use Committee Council Member Greenfield:
Pursuant to Rule 11.20(c) of the Council Rules and Section 197-d (b)(3) of the New York City Charter, the Council hereby resolves that the action of the City Planning Commission on Uniform Land Use Review Procedure (ULURP) application nos. C 120323 MMX shall be subject to Council review. This item is related to Application nos. C 150152 ZMX, C 150153 HUX and C 150154 HAX which are subject to Council review pursuant to Section 197-d(b)(1) of the New York City Charter.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Land Use Call-Up be Approved, by Council approved by Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Planning, Melrose Commons North, Bronx (C 120323 MMX, C 150152 ZMX, C 150153 HUX and C 150154 HAX)

Items.Title:
Introduction & Reading of Bills
See Attached
Discussion of Resolutions
Resolutions
General Discussion
Extension of Remarks
INTRODUCTION AND READING OF BILLS
A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to assessing the size of the city’s housing stock.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings
Items.MatterName: Assessing the size of the city’s housing stock.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon Congress to pass and the President to sign legislation to implement President Barack Obama’s “America’s College Promise” plan to make two years of community college free to anyone who maintains a 2.5 GPA and calling upon the New York State Legislature to pass and the Governor to sign legislation funding the State’s obligation under the plan.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Higher Education
Items.MatterName: America’s College Promise

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York in relation to the provision of sick time earned by employees.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Civil Service and Labor
Items.MatterName: Provision of sick time earned by employees.

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the New York State Legislature to pass and the Governor to sign, legislation to give correctional authorities the discretion to allow incarcerated women who give birth while in custody to return home on temporary supervised release for the first three weeks after they give birth.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Fire and Criminal Justice Services
Items.MatterName: Correctional authorities the discretion to allow incarcerated women who give birth while in custody to return home on temporary supervised release for the first three weeks after they give birth.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring the consideration of community impact in applications for base stations, black car bases, and luxury limousine bases.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation
Items.MatterName: Requiring the consideration of community impact in applications for base stations, black car bases, and luxury limousine bases.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to prohibiting obstructions or nuisances in or upon sidewalks, flagging or curbstones, streets and medians of streets and establishing a rebuttable presumption regarding responsibility for the placement of signs constituting such obstructions or nuisances.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Sanitation and Solid Waste Management
Items.MatterName: Prohibiting obstructing signs on sidewalks, flagging and curbstone whether or not abutting the offending property.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to a police computer technology strategy plan that includes a phase-out of the use of typewriters.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Technology
Items.MatterName: Police computer technology strategy plan that includes a phase-out of the use of typewriters.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring the commissioner of the department of correction to post a monthly report on detainees on the department’s website.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Fire and Criminal Justice Services
Items.MatterName: Requiring the commissioner of the dept of correction to post a monthly report on detainees on the department’s website.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to making available optional rapid HIV tests to students at city university of New York campuses.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Health
Items.MatterName: Making available optional rapid HIV tests to students at city university of NY campuses.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the City University of New York (CUNY) to incorporate the Muslim holidays of Eid Ul-Fitr and Eid Ul-Adha as observed university holidays throughout the CUNY system.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Higher Education
Items.MatterName: CUNY to incorporate the Muslim holidays of Eid Ul-Fitr and Eid Ul-Adha as observed university holidays throughout the CUNY system.

Items.Title: Resolution calling on President Donald Trump to overturn the ban on transgender individuals serving in the military and for U.S. Secretary of Defense James Mattis to continue to allow transgender individuals to serve openly
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Civil Rights
Items.MatterName: Calling on President Trump to overturn the ban on transgender individuals serving in the military and for U.S. Secretary of Defense James Mattis to continue to allow transgender individuals to serve openly.

Items.Title: Resolution urging the United States Department of Homeland Security to end the practice of placing immigrant detainees in solitary confinement, except in emergency situations.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Immigration
Items.MatterName: Dept of Homeland Security to end the practice of placing immigrant detainees in solitary confinement, except in emergency situations.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the establishment of the Meatpacking Area business improvement district.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Finance
Items.MatterName: Meatpacking Area business improvement district, Manhattan

Items.Title: Resolution approving the new designation and changes in the designation of certain organizations to receive funding in the Expense Budget.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Finance
Items.MatterName: Approving the new designation and changes in the designation of certain organizations to receive funding in the Expense Budget.

Items.Title: Resolution concerning the establishment of the Meatpacking Area Business Improvement District in the Borough of Manhattan and setting the date, time and place for the public hearing to hear all persons interested in the establishment of such district
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Finance
Items.MatterName: Meatpacking Area Business Improvement District, Manhattan

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to a protocol relating to the accessibility of city government websites for persons with disabilities
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Technology
Items.MatterName: Protocol relating to the accessibility of city government websites for persons with disabilities.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to conduct in connection with offers to induce a person to vacate a dwelling unit
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Consumer Affairs
Items.MatterName: Conduct in connection with offers to induce a person to vacate a dwelling unit.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the provision of services to people living with HIV and AIDS.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on General Welfare
Items.MatterName: Provision of services to people living with HIV and AIDS.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the City of New York, in relation to extending the rent stabilization laws.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings
Items.MatterName: Extending the rent stabilization laws.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring the department of transportation to notify 311 and place information on its website regarding the location of motor vehicles towed due to a temporary parking restriction change.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation
Items.MatterName: DOT to notify 311 and place information on its website regarding the location of motor vehicles towed due to a temporary parking restriction change.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the placement of newsracks near taxi stands.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation
Items.MatterName: Placement of newsracks near taxi stands.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to amending the definition of harassment to include illegal conversions of dwelling units.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings
Items.MatterName: Amending the definition of harassment to include illegal conversions of dwelling units.

Items.Title: A Local Law in relation to establishing a housing discrimination testing program.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Civil Rights
Items.MatterName: Establishing a housing discrimination testing program.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to fully implement the education funding requirements for New York City resulting from the Campaign for Fiscal Equity v State of New York case.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Education
Items.MatterName: NYS Legislature to fully implement the education funding requirements for NYC resulting from the Campaign for Fiscal Equity v State of NY case.

Items.Title: A Local Law in relation to establishing an employment discrimination testing program.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Civil Rights
Items.MatterName: Establishing an employment discrimination testing program.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to extending the statute of limitations period for appealing a Board of Standards and Appeals decision
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Governmental Operations
Items.MatterName: Extending the statute of limitations period for appealing a Board of Standards and Appeals decision

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the New York city building code, in relation to increasing the number of electric vehicle charging stations in open parking lots and parking garages.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings
Items.MatterName: Increasing the number of electric vehicle charging stations in open parking lots and parking garages.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to reducing unnecessary illumination in city-owned and city-controlled spaces.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Environmental Protection
Items.MatterName: Reducing unnecessary illumination in city-owned and city-controlled spaces.

Items.Title: Resolution recognizing and endorsing Earth Week 2015.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Environmental Protection
Items.MatterName: Recognizing and endorsing Earth Week 2015

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to bicycle access for elevators in residential buildings
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings
Items.MatterName: Bicycle access for elevators in residential buildings.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to reporting on bicycle related fatalities.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation
Items.MatterName: Reporting on bicycle related fatalities.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the regulation of laundries and to repeal subchapter 14 of chapter 2 of title 20 of such code, relating to the regulation of laundries
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Consumer Affairs
Items.MatterName: Regulation of laundries.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to designating communications havens for emergency events.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Fire and Criminal Justice Services
Items.MatterName: Designating communications havens for emergency events.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the United States Congress to pass and the President to sign H.R. 592, also known as the Federal Disaster Assistance Nonprofit Fairness Act of 2013, which would amend the Robert T. Stafford Disaster Relief and Emergency Assistance Act to make houses of worship eligible, as “private nonprofit facilities,” to receive financial assistance from the federal government for the repair, restoration, and replacement of facilities damaged or destroyed by major disasters, including Superstorm Sandy.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Recovery and Resiliency
Items.MatterName: Federal Disaster Assistance Nonprofit Fairness Act of 2013 (.H.R. 592)

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to introduce and pass, and the Governor to sign, legislation providing for a five hundred dollar property tax rebate to eligible homeowners in the city of New York.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Finance
Items.MatterName: Providing for a $500 property tax rebate to eligible homeowners in the city of NY.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the New York city charter and the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to authorizing the construction and regulation of licensed hostels.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings
Items.MatterName: Authorizing the construction and regulation of licensed hostels.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to required disclosures by persons making buyout offers
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings
Items.MatterName: Required disclosures by persons making buyout offers.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to pass, and the Governor to approve, A.1865, in relation to repealing vacancy decontrol.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings
Items.MatterName: Repealing vacancy decontrol. (A.1865)

Items.Title: Resolution determining that a public emergency requiring rent control in the City of New York continues to exist and will continue to exist on and after April 1, 2015.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings
Items.MatterName: Determining that a public emergency requiring rent control in the City of New York continues to exist and will continue to exist on and after April 1, 2015.

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the United States Department of Health and Human Services to allocate funding to any hospitals, whether public or private, located in close proximity to the five international airports where all travelers flying into the United States from West Africa must enter.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Health
Items.MatterName: US Dept of Health and Human Services to allocate funding to any hospitals, whether public or private, located in close proximity to the five international airports where all travelers flying into the US from West Africa must enter.

Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Public Safety
Items.MatterName: Governor to sign legislation expunging all misdemeanor convictions for low-level marijuana related offenses that occurred in NYC from 2000 through 2014.

Items.ActionText: This Land Use Application was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Land Use
